subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously on
Survivor:Although there were only five

Villains tribe was completelycontrolled by women.

They think I'm on the outside,when I'm the leader.

in the greatest danger.>> We're the ones on the outs.

in a row...Heroes win immunity!
(Heroes cheer)...Courtney was the next to go.
But Sandra made a brilliant moveto save her friend.
She convinced Russell that Coachhad turned on him.
>> Russell's so stupid.He ate that crap up.
>> PROBST: Her plan worked.Courtney was spared,
and Coach was voted out...Coach, the tribe has spoken.
...leaving Jerri withouther closest ally.
11 are left.Who will be voted out tonight?
We went to Tribal Council andwe went ahead and voted out

for him.And that's why Coach is probably
now out there looking into thesky wondering where everything

at all.I had no idea that Coach was
gonna go tonight.Not a clue.
I'm not next, am I?>> No way, no way, no way.
>> Oh, God.>> You have my word.
I will not write your name down,I promise you that.
Obviously, it was last-minute,and I didn't want to tell you
'cause I didn't want to freakyou out.
>> Okay.>> Don't worry.
>> Yeah... I don't want to benext.
>> You're not going to.(Jerri laughs)
>> Coach was my one and onlyserious alliance.
I mean, he's the only personout here I trusted, so I'm still
going to stick true to thealliance that I created with
Russell, Parvati and Danielle,but at this point, that's all I
got.>> So, what happened?
>> You didn't know it was goingto happen?
>> I had a strong feeling that Iwasn't going to write his name
down.Coach betrayed me by telling
Sandra that he was trying toblindside me tonight.
>> I just wanted to make surethat I wasn't next...
>> No, I... I promise you, youain't next.
>> Okay.>> You see, we got five girls
on my tribe now.I feel great about it, because

Courtney, so they'll be the nextto go.
I promise you that.(theme song playing)
